subject: Re: New keyboard mapping
msgSnippet: ... Actually, I forgot to mention that the keyboard layout is merely for the Jerome font, not for Keyman. So far I ve only used the Jerome font for basic
messageBody:
--- In Read_Alphabet@y..., "wonder_roast" <Roasted_Beanie@m...> wrote:
> I recently downloaded rmgburke's new keyboard mapping for Keyman and
> the html file to go with it. First, some of the keys he claims are
> assigned are wrong. I.e. typing aj yields the alternate form of
> the 'uh' character, not typing uh. I made quite a few changes (both
> to the keyman file and the html file) to suit my own personal
> preferences. If anyone would like me to post the files, please let
> me know.

Actually, I forgot to mention that the keyboard layout is merely for the Jerome font, not for Keyman. So far I've only used the Jerome font for basic typing, not Keyman for letter combinations.

So basically it's just a character map so that I wouldn't have to keep Windows Character Map open the whole time.
